entry.title: Property calendarWeekNumbering does not exist in Element sap.ui.unified.calendar.Month
entry.content:
Hi Expert,

after system upgrade, we have an error in various applications related to DatePicker object :

abap.js:64 Assertion failed: ManagedObject.apply: encountered unknown setting "calendarWeekNumbering" for class "sap.ui.unified.calendar.Month" (value:"Default")

We are on SAPUI5 1.71.75, and we have upgraded the SAPUI5 component from SAP_UI 754 0006 to SAP_UI 754 0008.

Applications works fine from WebIde and also in the landscape system that are still not upgraded.

Instead If we launch the application from Fiori Launchpad we have the issue.

Do you have some advice ? 

Thanks

Massimo

entry.title: smart filter bar not visible after smart table personalisation in SAP Fiori custom app.
entry.content:
Hi Experts,

We have developed a custom Fiori application using Smart Filter bar and Smart table. 

When we create a custom variant using personalization and set the variant as default the smart filter bar is not visible this happens after we logoff and login again. 

 

We are not seeing any issue if we set the variant as standard. We haven't done any customization in the coding as we just mapped entityset and kept "useperonization=true".

 

KR,

Anji

entry.title: Cancel Billing Document (VF11) – Billing Document field always resets to previous
entry.content:
When using the Fiori app Cancel Billing Document (VF11), the Billing Document input field always reverts to the previously cancelled document:

I cancel a billing document, and the number remains in the VF11 screen. When I try to enter another billing document, the field is cleared and the previous number reappears

I checked my user parameters and looked for any application variants, but did not find any.

entry.title: Reduction of the net amount when using the gas calculation schema S4hana
entry.content:
When generating a contract in VA41 using the gas calculation scheme, entering the ZPR0 condition (manual value) with a net value of R$273,814,983.00 changes the net value above taxes to R$273,814,359.39.

However, when creating the same scenario using the energy calculation scheme and entering the ZPR0 condition with the same net value of R$273,814,983.00, the net value above taxes remains unchanged.

I need to understand why the gas contract causes this reduction in the net value and, more importantly, how to adjust it to behave like the energy contract.

entry.title: UI5 Aggregatable Properties using annotations to calculate SUM of a table column
entry.content:
Hello, 

Is it possible to calculate the total value of the table column using local annotaions in Fiori App? As per the UI5 documentation, it is possible to define aggergatable properties using annotations. However, I couldnt make it work.  https://sapui5.hana.ondemand.com/#/topic/7f844f1021cd4791b8f7408eac7c1cec(Defining Aggregatable Properties)

            <Annotations Target="MM_PUR_CTRITEMACCT_MNTR_SRV.C_ContractItemAcctMntrType">
                <Annotation Term="Aggregation.CustomAggregate" Qualifier="OrderQuantity" String="Edm.Decimal" />
                <Annotation Term="Aggregation.CustomAggregate" Qualifier="Quantity" String="Edm.Decimal" />
            </Annotations>

            <Annotations Target="MM_PUR_CTRITEMACCT_MNTR_SRV.C_ContractItemAcctMntrType/OrderQuantity">
                <Annotation Term="Aggregation.default" EnumMember="Aggregation.defaultType/SUM" />
                <Annotation Term="Analytics.Measure" Bool="true" />
            </Annotations>

            <Annotations Target="MM_PUR_CTRITEMACCT_MNTR_SRV.C_ContractItemAcctMntrType/Quantity">
                <Annotation Term="Aggregation.default" EnumMember="Aggregation.defaultType/SUM" />
                <Annotation Term="Analytics.Measure" Bool="true" />
            </Annotations>

Alternatively, this could be acheived using the ABAP CDS Annotation @DefaultAggregation: #SUM. Unfortunately, this standard CDS view consumed by the App is not extensible.

Thanks

entry.title: In-House Kanban EWM without using planned or production orders
entry.content:
We are setting up a new production cell that would like to kit a complete tray of materials from a sub-assembly through kanban.

The idea is the kanban of the sub-assy is set to empty. 

A WT is created for each of the components in the BOM of the sub-assy

When confirmed the components are moved from the warehouse to the cell

Kanban is set it to full

The sub assy is confirmed via MFBF and components backflushed from the cell.

We don't want any planned or production orders being created, we just want it to replenish the material from the warehouse to the shopfloor. Is this even possible and if so could someone help outline what config etc is needed please?

entry.title: Error While Creating Extension Project in SAP Business Application Studio
entry.content:
I am encountering the following error when trying to create an extension project using the SAP Adaptation Project template:

"The Extensibility Project generator plugin was not found in your dev space and it is required for this action. To proceed, please install the 'SAPUI5 Layout Editor & Extensibility' extension."

However, my Fiori dev space already contains SAPUI5 Layout Editor & Extensibility as a predefined extension, but I am still facing the same issue.

entry.title: Fiori Overview Page – Card visibility not updating when switching variants
entry.content:
Hello,

I am working with an Overview Page (OVP) Fiori dashboard that contains multiple cards. I have created several variants where some cards are shown and others are hidden, depending on the variant.

The issue I am facing is that when I switch from one variant to another, the card visibility does not update as expected. The cards remain in the same hidden/visible state as the previous variant, instead of reflecting the configuration of the newly selected variant.

Has anyone encountered this behavior? Is there a specific setting or workaround required to ensure that card visibility is correctly updated when switching between variants?

entry.title: CAP Java: OData V2 Aggregation for SAPUI5 SmartTable (AnalyticalTable)
entry.content:
Hello,

I have a freestyle SAPUI5 application which consumes an OData V2 service which I develop using CAP Java with 

cds-adapter-odata-v2 adapter and my SAPUI5 app has a SmartTable with AnalyticalTable type to use the grouping and aggregation features. The AnalyticalBinding sends a request to the OData service to fetch grand total (aggregated results) of the properties annotated as "measure".

I have a similar application which works fine with CAP Node.js because the Node.js stack can return the aggregated result requested by the AnalyticalBinding.

The request sent by the AnalyticalBinding looks like the following:

/odata/v2/my-service/MyEntitySet?$select=myMeasureProp1&$inlinecount=allpages

I believe CAP Node.js framework interprets this request by checking the "@sap.aggregation.role" annotation and returns the aggregated result (sum in my case). However, CAP Java does not return the aggregated result, instead it returns all the entities individually containing the myMeasureProp1.

Here is an example response of CAP Node.js. It has only a single entity with the aggregated numbers. 

{
   "d":{
      "results":[
         {
            "__metadata":{
               "type":"Reporting.VAnalytics",
               "uri":"https://myhost.com/odata/v2/reporting/VAnalytics(aggregation'{\"key\":{},\"value\":[\"bookingHour\",\"nonApprovedHour\"]}')"
            },
            "bookingHour":"516899.1",
            "nonApprovedHour":"5303",
            "ID__":"aggregation'{\"key\":{},\"value\":[\"bookingHour\",\"nonApprovedHour\"]}'"
         }
      ],
      "__count":"1"
   }
}


I believe Java stack does not interpret the "@sap.aggregation.role" annotation. I checked the documentations and could not find anything useful. 

I'd appreciate any help on how to achieve using SmartTable with AnalyticalTable type consuming an OData V2 service provided by CAP Java.

Annotations:

annotate ReportingCenter.Analytics with @(sap.semantics: 'aggregate');

annotate ReportingCenter.Analytics with {
    employeeTeamID .aggregation.role: 'dimension';
    employeeID     .aggregation.role: 'dimension';
    projectID      .aggregation.role: 'dimension';
    projectTeamID  .aggregation.role: 'dimension';
    hours          .aggregation.role: 'measure';
};

annotate ReportingCenter.Analytics with @(UI: {PresentationVariant: {
    $Type         : 'UI.PresentationVariantType',
    Total         : [hours],
    GroupBy       : [
        employeeTeamID,
        employeeID,
        projectID
    ],
    Visualizations: ['@UI.LineItem']
}});


EDIT: I have also tried with the following annotations. They work fine with OData V4 using $apply query but my service is V2 since SAPUI5 smart controls are only supported for OData V2.

using ReportingCenter from '../../../../srv/cds-models/analytics';
using from './line-item';

annotate ReportingCenter.Analytics with @(sap.semantics: 'aggregate');

annotate ReportingCenter.Analytics with {
    employeeTeamID  @SAP.aggregation.role: 'dimension'  @analytics.Dimension;
    employeeID      @SAP.aggregation.role: 'dimension'  @analytics.Dimension;
    projectID       @SAP.aggregation.role: 'dimension'  @analytics.Dimension;
    projectTeamID   @SAP.aggregation.role: 'dimension'  @analytics.Dimension;
    hours           @SAP.aggregation.role: 'measure'    @analytics.Measure;
};

annotate ReportingCenter.Analytics with @(UI: {PresentationVariant: {
    $Type         : 'UI.PresentationVariantType',
    Total         : [hours],
    GroupBy       : [
        employeeTeamID,
        employeeID
    ],
    Visualizations: ['@UI.LineItem']
}});

annotate ReportingCenter.Analytics with @(Aggregation: {ApplySupported: {
    $Type                 : 'Aggregation.ApplySupportedType',
    Transformations       : [
        'aggregate',
        'identity',
        'groupby',
        'filter',
        'search'
    ],
    GroupableProperties   : [
        employeeTeamID,
        employeeID,
        projectID,
        projectTeamID
    ],
    AggregatableProperties: [{
        $Type   : 'Aggregation.AggregatablePropertyType',
        Property: hours
    }]
}});

annotate ReportingCenter.Analytics with @(Analytics.AggregatedProperty #sumHours: {
    $Type               : 'Analytics.AggregatedPropertyType',
    Name                : 'sumHours',
    AggregationMethod   : 'sum',
    AggregatableProperty: hours
});

entry.title: Deploy Your First SAPUI5 App : CF deployed mtar results in 500 Internal Server Error
entry.content:
Hi,

I tried out beginners tutorial 'Deploy Your First SAPUI5 App' https://developers.sap.com/tutorials/appstudio-sapui5-create..html 

While executing the steps 1 to 5 I realized that screenshots and steps are partly outdated. But I managed to adapt the outdated tutorial stuff to what is really showing up; 

Step 1.-4: done, nothing worth to mention

Step 5: Deploy the archive to Cloud Foundry

  1. mtar successfully deployed (substeps 1.-3. in step 5)
  2. command "cf html5-list -di sagbtpsapui5-destination-service -u --runtime launchpad" (not "cf html5-list -di sap-btp-sapui5-dest-srv -u --runtime launchpad" as mentioned in the tutorial) resulted in the expected output, which contains the launch Url (see [1] at the bottom)

Step 6: Test to the application

=> Calling the Url (retrieved from the cf html-list cmd in Step 5) in my browser (Safari and Chrome, both tested) results in a 500 Internal Server Error

  • Anyone know what mit have gone wrong here?
  • Could/should this still work with the (a bit outdated) tutorial? Anyone else have experience with this tutorial? (failing as well or managed to run the URL?)

Thank you very much for any help and / or feedback.

[1] terminal output of the cf html-list comand (tutorial step 5, substep 4)

user: sapui5 $ cf html5-list -di sagbtpsapui5-destination-service -u --runtime launchpad
Getting list of HTML5 applications available via destinations in org 036c5c40trial / space dev as <<user.@acme.de>>...
OK

name version app-host-id service name destination name last changed url
sagbtpsapui5 0.0.1 27f1a143-9ede-4cdb-905a-26ea5a197c58 sagbtpsapui5 sagbtpsapui5_html_repo_host Fri, 03 Oct 2025 09:37:32 GMT https://036c5c40trial.launchpad.cfapps.us10.hana.ondemand.com/17488d62-a432-4653-bcc1-d910cd48a8b4.sagbtpsapui5.sagbtpsapui5-0.0.1/

entry.title: Fragment not showing data in SAPUI5 app in SAP BAS (Component-preload.js & model issue)
entry.content:
Hello Experts,

I am creating a simple “Hello SAPUI5” app in SAP Business Application Studio (BAS) to practice MVC, data binding, fragments, and routing.

I am facing two issues:
1. When I click “Open Dialog”, the fragment opens but no data is displayed.
2. In the console, I see:
• Component-preload.js not found
• Manifest: dataSource "localModel" not found or invalid

Folder Structure:
webapp/
├── index.html
├── Component.js
├── manifest.json
├── model/
│    └── data.json
├── view/
│    └── View1.view.xml
├── controller/
│    └── View1.controller.js
└── fragment/
     └── Dialog.fragment.xml


manifest.json (relevant part)

{
  "_version": "1.12.0",
  "sap.app": {
    "id": "myApp",
    "type": "application",
    "applicationVersion": {
      "version": "1.0.0"
    },
    "title": "Hello SAPUI5"
  },
  "sap.ui": {
    "technology": "UI5",
    "deviceTypes": {
      "desktop": true,
      "tablet": true,
      "phone": true
    }
  },
  "sap.ui5": {
    "dependencies": {
      "minUI5Version": "1.84.0",
      "libs": {
        "sap.m": {}
      }
    },
    "rootView": {
      "viewName": "myApp.view.App",
      "type": "XML",
      "async": true,
      "id": "app"
    },
    "dataSources": {
      "localModel": {
        "uri": "model/data.json",
        "type": "JSON"
      }
    },
    "models": {
      "": {
        "dataSource": "localModel",
        "type": "sap.ui.model.json.JSONModel",
         "settings": {
          "preload": true
        }
      }
    },
   
    "routing": {
      "config": {
        "routerClass": "sap.m.routing.Router",
        "viewType": "XML",
        "viewPath": "myApp.view",
        "controlId": "app",
        "controlAggregation": "pages",
        "async": true
      },
      "routes": [
        {
          "pattern": "",
          "name": "View1",
          "target": "View1"
        },
        {
          "pattern": "View2",
          "name": "View2",
          "target": "View2"
        }
      ],
      "targets": {
        "View1": {
          "viewName": "View1"
        },
        "View2": {
          "viewName": "View2"
        }
      }
    }
  }
}




model/data.json

{
 "employee": {
   "name": "Ashwin",
   "role": "SAPUI5 Developer"
 },
 "team": [
   { "name": "Ravi", "role": "Backend Developer" },
   { "name": "Meera", "role": "UI Designer" },
   { "name": "John", "role": "Tester" }
 ]
}


fragment/Dialog.fragment.xml

<core:FragmentDefinition xmlns="sap.m" xmlns:core="sap.ui.core">
<Dialog title="Employee Info">
<content>
<Text text="{name}" />
<Text text="{role}" />
</content>
<buttons>
<Button text="Close" press=".onCloseDialog" />
</buttons>
</Dialog>
</core:FragmentDefinition>


 View1.controller.js (fragment loading)

sap.ui.define([
 "sap/ui/core/mvc/Controller",
 "sap/m/MessageToast",
 "sap/ui/core/syncStyleClass"
], function (Controller, MessageToast, syncStyleClass) {
 "use strict";
 return Controller.extend("myApp.controller.View1", {
   onNavToView2: function () {
     this.getOwnerComponent().getRouter().navTo("View2");
   },
   onOpenDialog: function () {
     var that = this;
     if (!this._pDialog) {
       this._pDialog = this.loadFragment({ name: "myApp.fragment.Dialog" }).then(function (oDialog) {
         that.getView().addDependent(oDialog);
         // Forward content density
         var sDensity = that.getOwnerComponent().getContentDensityClass
           ? that.getOwnerComponent().getContentDensityClass()
           : "";
         if (sDensity) syncStyleClass(sDensity, that.getView(), oDialog);
         //  bind employee context to fragment
         oDialog.setModel(that.getView().getModel());
         oDialog.bindElement("/employee");
         return oDialog;
       });
     }
     this._pDialog.then(function (oDialog) { oDialog.open(); });
   },
   onCloseDialog: function () {
     if (this._pDialog) this._pDialog.then(function (oDialog) { oDialog.close(); });
   }
 });
});

 

Here is the UI Fragment:

 


Console Errors
• Component-preload.js not found
• Manifest: dataSource "localModel" not found or invalid
• Fragment opens, but data is not shown

Expected:
When I click “Open Dialog”, it should show:
Employee: Ashwin
Role: SAPUI5 Developer

Question:
• Am I binding the fragment incorrectly?
• Do I need to load the JSON model differently in BAS?
• How to fix the Component-preload.js not found error?

Thanks in advance for your guidance!

entry.title: Sending einvoice to ZATCA after receipt of Advance Payment
entry.content:
Hello,

As per ZATCA guidelines, an eInvoice should be issued only after receiving the payment. In the standard process, a Down Payment Request (FAZ) is created after the Sales Order using a milestone billing plan and before the payment is received.

I have a similar requirement for a Saudi customer and would like to know if there is a standard out-of-the-box solution to trigger the eInvoice upon payment receipt, in alignment with the down payment request process linked to the sales order. Additionally, I would appreciate it if you could share the steps or approach you have followed in the past to trigger eInvoice submission to ZATCA after payment receipt for Saudi Arabia customers.

Regards

Mohammed Roshan

entry.title: Resolving Business Application Studio - BAS: - sh: 1: fiori: Permission denied
entry.content:
Problem:
While running SAPUI5 application in BAS, I am facing the below error:

sh: 1: fiori: Permission denied
Prerequisites:
Created a brand new SAPUI5 Freestyle application.

Configured necessary files:

ui5.yaml

ui5-local.yaml

ui5-deploy.yaml

package.json​
Runtime configuration is already set up.

Solution:

Run the following commands in the BAS Terminal:

 


rm -rf node_modules
npm install
npm run start-fixed
Before running the last command, ensure that your package.json includes the following script:


"start-fixed": "ui5 serve --port 8080"

entry.title: Adaptation editor for SAPUI5 adaptation project with VS Code - On Prem
entry.content:
Hello everyone,

I’ve created a UI5 adaptation project using the new Adaptation Editor generator (from the latest UI5 tooling update).

The project generation and build completed successfully without any errors.

However, when I try to preview or open the Adaptation Editor from my variant, the browser launches but:

  • The application does not render (blank page).

  • No UI5 controls or components are loaded.

  • The console doesn’t show any clear errors related to UI5 modules, but the app never initializes.

Here’s what I’ve done and verified so far:

  1. Generated the adaptation project via the new generator (https://www.npmjs.com/package/@sap-ux/generator-adp)

  2. file .variant structure are correctly created.

  3. Verified that the base application loads normally outside of the adaptation project.

  4. Tried different browsers and cleared the cache — same result.

Question:

  1. Has anyone experienced this behavior with the new Adaptation Editor generator ?
  2. Is there any known configuration or dependency missing to make the preview work properly ?

Any insights or troubleshooting steps would be greatly appreciated.

entry.title: Unable to extend standard Fiori app
entry.content:
Hello everyone,

I’m working on the standard SAP Fiori app F1643A – on SAP S/4HANA 2023 (on-premise S03).
Documentation: https://fioriappslibrary.hana.ondemand.com/sap/fix/externalViewer/#/detail/Apps('F1643A')/S30OP 

The requirement is to display some custom fields that were generated and are already available in the classic ME51N transaction.

However, in the app documentation link above, I couldn’t find the “Extension” tab, does that mean that the app cannot be extended ? or is there another way to enable those fields in this app?

Thank you in advance for your help!

entry.title: SAP Fiori Elements Funktion Import Copy Row
entry.content:
I have a Fiori Elements app with a list report page and an object page. When I click the Copy one Row button on the list report page, a new row with the same values as the selected row is created. I am then automatically redirected to the object page, where I can edit the data in the new row. However, when I click Cancel, the new row is still displayed in the list even though I have not saved the data. How can I prevent this behavior?

  METHOD /iwbep/if_mgw_appl_srv_runtime~execute_action.
    DATA : ls_parameter        TYPE /iwbep/s_mgw_name_value_pair,
           ls_zleiter_ausnahme TYPE zleiter_ausnahme,
           ls_result           TYPE zleiter_ausnahme,
           ls_entity           TYPE  zcl_zodata_leiter_aus_mpc=>ts_leiterausnahmen,
           lt_entityset        TYPE zcl_zodata_leiter_aus_mpc=>tt_leiterausnahmen.

    IF iv_action_name = 'CopyRow'.

      "read parameters
      READ TABLE it_parameter INTO ls_parameter WITH KEY name = 'LA_ID'.
      READ TABLE it_parameter INTO DATA(ls_keys_app) WITH KEY name = 'APP_ID'.
      ls_zleiter_ausnahme-la_id = ls_parameter-value.
      ls_zleiter_ausnahme-app_id = ls_keys_app-value.


      "select new values
      "do you know - even if you haven't yet committed the changes,
      "system will return new data
      "search 'transaction isolation levels' to read more on this
      SELECT SINGLE * FROM zleiter_ausnahme
        WHERE  la_id = @LS_zleiter_ausnahme-la_id AND app_id = @LS_zleiter_ausnahme-app_id
        INTO CORRESPONDING FIELDS OF @LS_result .
      IF sy-subrc = 0.
        SELECT MAX( la_id ) FROM zleiter_ausnahme INTO @DATA(lv_id).
        ADD 1 TO lv_id.
        ls_result-la_id = lv_id.
        ls_result-la_datum = sy-datum.
        ls_result-la_aenderer = sy-uname.
     MODIFY zleiter_ausnahme FROM ls_result.

        DATA: ls_entityset LIKE LINE OF lt_entityset.

*      ls_entityset-aenderer = ls_result-la_aenderer.
        ls_entityset-aenderer = sy-uname.
        ls_entityset-bemerkung = ls_result-la_bemerkung.
*      ls_entityset-date = ls_result-la_datum.
        ls_entityset-date = sy-datum.
        ls_entityset-datefrom = ls_result-la_datum_von.
        ls_entityset-dateto = ls_result-la_datum_bis.
        ls_entityset-int2 = ls_result-la_id.
        ls_entityset-kostl = ls_result-la_kostl.
        ls_entityset-ktr = ls_result-la_ktr.
        ls_entityset-mandt = ls_result-mandt.
        ls_entityset-username = ls_result-la_nutzer.
        ls_entityset-int1 = ls_result-app_id.
        ls_entityset-app_description = ls_result-app_bezeichnung.

      APPEND ls_entityset TO lt_entityset.

* call methos copy_data_to_ref and export entity set data
        copy_data_to_ref( EXPORTING is_data = ls_entityset

                CHANGING cr_data = er_data ).
      ELSE.
        "Fehlerbehandlung - Quellrecord nicht gefunden
        RAISE EXCEPTION TYPE /iwbep/cx_mgw_busi_exception
          EXPORTING
            textid  = /iwbep/cx_mgw_busi_exception=>business_error
            message = 'Quelldatensatz nicht gefunden'.
      ENDIF.
    ENDIF .
**TRY.
*CALL METHOD SUPER->/IWBEP/IF_MGW_APPL_SRV_RUNTIME~EXECUTE_ACTION
**  EXPORTING
**    iv_action_name          =
**    it_parameter            =
**    io_tech_request_context =
**  IMPORTING
**    er_data                 =
*    .
** CATCH /iwbep/cx_mgw_busi_exception .
** CATCH /iwbep/cx_mgw_tech_exception .
**ENDTRY.
  ENDMETHOD.

entry.title: Reverse the open credit document
entry.content:
Document 523000000181 with source 77 can only be reversed by invoicing doc reversal

I am not able to reverse the open credit document, please suggest me the process, how to do that.
